page.title: 03LITTLE WITLEY LIFE - CHURCH
page.content: We have no village school or shop. As the ecclesiastical{parish } (electoral roll 136) is now a united benefice with Shrawley and Great Witley, we are lucky still to have our own chapel, thanks in part to the Friends of St. Michael formed in 1976. Our rector, Canon Barnish sadly died earlier this year. As there is only a joint Parochial Church Council, the Friends and the Chapel wardens organize our{two services}a month, including the family communion with classes for the children, the annual Harvest Supper and Christmas Carol Service. "Gambling" plays an important part in fundraising to maintain the churh fabric and churchyard; crazy casino evenings are so well organized and successful that the Friends are asked to organize evenings for other associations.
